title: Marks and Spencer pins revival hopes on relaunch Per Una fashion label
text:
Marks & Spencer is relaunching its largest womenswear label Per Una as it desperately tries to refresh its ailing fashion department.

It has kicked off a major campaign to try to shift the perceptions that its clothes are dowdy and 'too frilly', the company said.

It will also make a foray into 'influencer marketing' – paying social media celebrities to feature M&S clothes – to go alongside traditional print and billboard advertising.

M&S is relaunching its largest womenswear label Per Una, while also will also making a foray into 'influencer marketing' – paying social media celebrities to feature M&S clothes

The move is part of the retailer's plans to broaden its appeal to a younger, 'family age' customer, and the updated collection will be 'the first thing you see when you walk into an M&S store', the company said.

Last week, chief executive Steve Rowe admitted the company's turnaround was 18 months behind schedule in clothing and homeware.

Jill Stanton, director of womenswear, said: 'With Per Una, we've refreshed a muchloved brand to give it a more contemporary feel.'

Shares in M&S fell 0.5 per cent, or 0.9p, to 170.95p yesterday – their lowest since 2000.
